paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V122I, including penetrance data from two case reports.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Progressive and refractory congestive HF, echocardiographic features of restrictive cardiomyopathy.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic testing after pretest counseling revealed the presence of V122I gene mutation (heterozygote).

individual_records.phenotype_details: Worsening dyspnea on exertion, intermittent bilateral hand tremors.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient had testing after appropriate genetic counseling, which revealed heterozygosity for the V122I transthyretin protein.

functional_data.summary: The V122I mutation is associated with a cardiomyopathy phenotype and may also present with neurological symptoms.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family as both cases are affected.
variants.additional_notes: Both cases show significant clinical manifestations of the V122I mutation.
key_quotes: Patients with hereditary ATTR secondary to V122I mutation usually present with a cardiomyopathy phenotype.
Genetic testing after pretest counseling revealed the presence of V122I gene mutation (heterozygote).

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted detailed penetrance data from individual cases.
